channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Mixed
item.description: U.S. stocks were mixed. Oracle was down after slightly disappointing results.

item.title: As UnitedHealth shooting puts health insurance in focus, 4 million people could get priced out of coverage if Congress doesn’t act
item.description: Inaction on Capitol Hill could soon make healthcare plans more expensive, potentially adding to the country’s uninsured rate amid rising premiums.

item.title: UBS Extends Its U.S. Wealth Arm to Serve More Than Just the Ultrarich
item.description: Chasing higher margins, and rivals, the bank’s U.S. boss is making a move for more clients and banking services.

item.title: Europe's Gas Prices Forecast to Halve on Rising LNG Supply
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures are lower on a slightly milder shift in overnight temperature forecasts and lower LNG feedgas flows. In Europe, prices are ex...

item.title: I’m a 59-year-old recluse with PTSD and no living relatives. I have $900,000 in savings. How should I distribute my assets?
item.description: “I have a large bank as trustee, and it will take a large chunk to distribute my estate.”

item.title: Investor optimism for U.S. stocks eclipsing 2000’s dot-com bubble raises ‘negative’ shock risk
item.description: “U.S. consumers have never felt so optimistic about gains in the stock market over the next 12 months,” according to Deutsche Bank Research.

item.title: Dollar Might Ease Slightly in 2025
item.description: The dollar was strengthening, but could fall modestly next year as pessimism about the eurozone ebbs, Societe Generale said.

item.title: Gold Futures Rise as China Resumes Buying Bullion
item.description: Gold futures climbed after China’s central bank restarted gold purchases for the first time in six months.

item.title: Traders are pretty sure of a Fed rate cut. What happens if inflation data is too hot?
item.description: Traders are pretty confident the Fed will deliver a rate cut next week. What happens if inflation data throws the market a curveball.

item.title: The Social Security Fairness Act is a bad idea
item.description: This legislation would allow some workers to double-dip and speeds the exhaustion of the trust fund
